omi_core.subject: English
omi_core.title: Decodes CVC words in isolation and connected text

progress_descriptors.Emerging: Identifies some initial sounds; attempts to blend two-phoneme chunks with support.
progress_descriptors.Developing: Blends three phonemes to read CVC words with prompts (e.g., c-a-t → cat).
progress_descriptors.Consolidating: Independently blends and reads familiar CVC words in decodable text.
progress_descriptors.Proficient: Reads a range of CVC words fluently within sentences; self-corrects when needed.
progress_descriptors.Exceeding: Transfers CVC decoding to words with simple suffixes (e.g., cats) in connected text.

evidence_examples.example: Student says /p/-/i/-/g/ then ‘pig’ when shown the word.
Reads ‘cats’ and explains that <s> means ‘more than one’.
evidence_examples.context: Guided reading group with picture-supported sentences.

omi_core.subject: English
omi_core.title: Decodes words with adjacent consonants and common digraphs

progress_descriptors.Emerging: Identifies individual consonant sounds in simple clusters with teacher modelling.
progress_descriptors.Developing: Reads words with adjacent consonants at the beginning or end with support (e.g., stop, milk).
progress_descriptors.Consolidating: Independently decodes words with adjacent consonants and common digraphs in connected text.
progress_descriptors.Proficient: Maintains phrasing and accuracy when reading words with clusters across a page.
progress_descriptors.Exceeding: Explains which graphemes represent each phoneme in cluster words and applies this to unfamiliar words.

evidence_examples.example: Reads ‘frog’, ‘plan’, ‘bench’, ‘gift’ accurately without using picture cues.

omi_core.subject: English
omi_core.title: Decodes long-vowel patterns, diphthongs, and r-controlled vowels in connected text

progress_descriptors.Emerging: Notices that one sound can be spelled different ways (e.g., <ai>, <a_e>).
progress_descriptors.Developing: Reads common long-vowel patterns in familiar words with prompts.
progress_descriptors.Consolidating: Accurately decodes long-vowel patterns, diphthongs, and r-controlled vowels in sentences.
progress_descriptors.Proficient: Reads with purpose and understanding across pages containing mixed patterns (e.g., rain, cane, cow, snow, bird).
progress_descriptors.Exceeding: Explains spelling–sound alternatives (e.g., <ow> in cow vs snow) and applies them to new words.

evidence_examples.example: Reads ‘The goat ate hay in the shade’ accurately; explains <a_e> says /ā/.

omi_core.subject: English
omi_core.title: Explains causes and outcomes using if/then and why/how language

progress_descriptors.Emerging: Answers who/what/where; uses ‘because’ or ‘so’ in short responses with support.
progress_descriptors.Developing: Asks and answers why/how questions about familiar events.
progress_descriptors.Consolidating: Uses if/then statements to link actions and outcomes in class talk.
progress_descriptors.Proficient: Explains choices or events using cause–effect language across a short recount or presentation.
progress_descriptors.Exceeding: Suggests alternative causes/outcomes (what if …) and justifies predictions.

evidence_examples.example: ‘If it’s raining, then we stay inside, because the ground is slippery.’
evidence_examples.context: Circle time discussion after a shared text.

omi_core.subject: English
omi_core.title: Prepares and delivers a short recitation or oral presentation using prompts

progress_descriptors.Emerging: Recites a short class rhyme with a group, following cues.
progress_descriptors.Developing: Recites a short text independently with visual prompts.
progress_descriptors.Consolidating: Prepares and presents a short talk on a familiar topic using pictures or notes.
progress_descriptors.Proficient: Adjusts volume/pace and uses simple non-verbal communication to support meaning.
progress_descriptors.Exceeding: Presents confidently with independently prepared prompts; responds to one audience question.

evidence_examples.example: Gives a 30–60s talk about a pet using three picture cards as prompts.

omi_core.subject: English
omi_core.title: Comprehends meaning in simple texts through prediction and connection to experience

progress_descriptors.Emerging: Talks about pictures to guess what the text might be about.
progress_descriptors.Developing: Makes simple predictions about what will happen next in a familiar story.
progress_descriptors.Consolidating: Identifies key ideas and connects them to personal experiences.
progress_descriptors.Proficient: Explains events or ideas in a story and how they relate to own life or community.
progress_descriptors.Exceeding: Justifies predictions and connections using evidence from text or illustrations.

evidence_examples.example: Says ‘I think the dog will come back because he loves his boy.’

omi_core.subject: English
omi_core.title: Creates short multimodal texts to communicate ideas, using words, images, and signs

progress_descriptors.Emerging: Draws or signs to share simple ideas about self or experiences.
progress_descriptors.Developing: Combines drawings, letters, or signs to express an idea with support.
progress_descriptors.Consolidating: Creates short written or digital texts combining words and images.
progress_descriptors.Proficient: Writes or signs short texts with clear purpose and audience awareness.
progress_descriptors.Exceeding: Selects and integrates modes (e.g., images, words, signs, audio) to enhance message clarity.

evidence_examples.example: Creates a simple digital page combining text and picture to describe their pet.

omi_core.subject: English
omi_core.title: Uses language and sign to express personal identity, whakapapa, and connections to place

progress_descriptors.Emerging: Shares name or favourite things when prompted.
progress_descriptors.Developing: Talks or signs about family, pets, or home using simple sentences.
progress_descriptors.Consolidating: Describes who they are and where they come from using words, signs, or visuals.
progress_descriptors.Proficient: Explains personal stories that show belonging and relationships.
progress_descriptors.Exceeding: Expresses pride in identity, using cultural or language features that show connection to place.

evidence_examples.example: Signs or says ‘Ko Hemi tōku ingoa. I live in Ōtepoti.’

omi_core.subject: English
omi_core.title: Engages in reciprocal conversations to build shared understanding

progress_descriptors.Emerging: Responds nonverbally or with single words when spoken to.
progress_descriptors.Developing: Takes short turns in simple exchanges with support.
progress_descriptors.Consolidating: Listens, responds, and builds on others’ ideas in short exchanges.
progress_descriptors.Proficient: Initiates and sustains back-and-forth conversation on familiar topics.
progress_descriptors.Exceeding: Leads and extends conversations by inviting others to share ideas or feelings.

evidence_examples.example: Student waits, then asks peer ‘What do you think?’ after sharing their idea.

omi_core.subject: English
omi_core.title: Understands that print, sign, and digital symbols represent meaning and follow conventions

progress_descriptors.Emerging: Recognises their name or common logos.
progress_descriptors.Developing: Identifies that print and signs carry meaning (e.g., labels, class names).
progress_descriptors.Consolidating: Demonstrates directionality and one-to-one matching of spoken and printed words.
progress_descriptors.Proficient: Explains that symbols, letters, or signs represent sounds and meanings.
progress_descriptors.Exceeding: Recognises different conventions for meaning-making across media (e.g., emoji, signs, print).

evidence_examples.example: Points to each word while reading own name on a label.

policy_reference.curriculum_doc_ref: Reading: CVC decoding; continuous blending; suffix –s

omi_meta.accessibility_notes: Permit oral, signed (NZSL), or AAC responses; allow fingerspelling; minimise reliance on pictures for word identification.

ell_alignment.notes: Teach phonemes with graphemes; note L1 phoneme inventory differences.

omi_meta.next_steps: Introduce adjacent consonants and common digraphs in connected text.

policy_reference.source_title: English Years 0–2 / Reading – Adjacent consonants & digraphs
policy_reference.curriculum_doc_ref: Decoding adjacent consonants; CCVC/CVCC; digraphs in connected text

omi_meta.accessibility_notes: Provide masked-picture texts to reduce cueing; support NZSL articulation for clusters.

ell_alignment.notes: Some L1s lack clusters; teach explicitly.

policy_reference.source_title: English Year 2 / Reading – Long vowels, diphthongs, r-controlled vowels
policy_reference.curriculum_doc_ref: Long-vowel patterns (a_e/ai/ay etc.), diphthongs (oi/oy, ou/ow), r-controlled vowels

omi_meta.accessibility_notes: Use decodable texts aligned to sequence; pair contrasting patterns (e.g., <ow> cow vs <ow> snow).

policy_reference.source_title: English Phase 1 / Oral Language – Verbal reasoning & Reciprocal Meaning-Making

omi_meta.accessibility_notes: Allow NZSL/AAC; visual supports for if/then frames.

policy_reference.source_title: English Phase 1 / Oral Language – Presenting to Others
policy_reference.curriculum_doc_ref: Recitations; short oral presentations; prompts/visuals; non-verbal communication

omi_meta.accessibility_notes: Accept signed/multimodal presentations; allow notes and visuals.

policy_reference.curriculum_doc_ref: Comprehends simple texts through prediction and connection

omi_meta.accessibility_notes: Provide picture-supported texts; encourage oral/NZSL connections to experience.

ell_alignment.notes: Link text to prior knowledge using visuals and L1 scaffolds.

omi_meta.next_steps: Move to inference and justification from text.

policy_reference.curriculum_doc_ref: Creates short multimodal texts to communicate ideas

omi_meta.accessibility_notes: Allow digital, visual, or signed composition methods.

ell_alignment.notes: Encourage use of first-language vocabulary alongside English.

omi_meta.next_steps: Expand multimodal vocabulary and purpose awareness.

policy_reference.source_title: English Phase 1 / Oral Language – Expressing Identity
policy_reference.curriculum_doc_ref: Uses language and sign to express personal identity and connections to place

omi_meta.accessibility_notes: Include mihi frameworks, bilingual sharing, and NZSL equivalence.

ell_alignment.notes: Support confidence expressing identity in English and L1.

omi_meta.next_steps: Add comparison with others’ identities and cultures.

policy_reference.source_title: English Phase 1 / Oral Language – Reciprocal Meaning-Making
policy_reference.curriculum_doc_ref: Engages in reciprocal conversation to build shared understanding

omi_meta.accessibility_notes: Provide visual prompts and structured turn-taking supports.

ell_alignment.notes: Model turn-taking frames and listening responses.

omi_meta.next_steps: Introduce group dialogue and reasoning tasks.

policy_reference.source_title: English Phase 1 / Reading – Concepts About Print & Symbolic Understanding
policy_reference.curriculum_doc_ref: Understands print, sign, and digital symbols represent meaning and follow conventions

omi_meta.accessibility_notes: Include signed/visual print awareness; label bilingual environments.

ell_alignment.notes: Build concept of word and directionality explicitly.

omi_meta.next_steps: Begin formal decoding instruction linked to known print concepts.
